New Records: Germany won 5-0 against Hungary in the UEFA Nations League, marking their biggest win in the competition so far.
Key Match Events: Fullkrug scored the opening goal in the 27th minute, Musiala doubled the lead in the 58th minute, Wirtz scored in the 66th minute, Pavlovic made it 4-0 in the 77th minute, and Havertz sealed the win with a penalty in the 81st minute. Nego scored a consolation goal for Hungary in the 9th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany's new captain Joshua Kimmich is set to play at right-back, while uncapped Angelo Stiller is one of five contenders to feature in a new-look engine room. Leroy Sane is still troubled by a groin injury and missed out on selection.
Post-Match Reflections: There were no post-match comments provided in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany's win marked their first in the UEFA Nations League this season.
Others: Germany's lineup featured several new faces, including Marc-Andre ter Stegen in goal and Nico Schlotterbeck and Jonathan Tah in central defence.
